Class Query

java.lang.Object
Query
public class Query extends Object
The attributes used to create a Query object are composed of a string constituting the query and two ArrayLists containing the parameters to be included in the query. The position of the parameter in the ArrayList corresponds to the position of the parameter in the query.

INF201 : Java project

Author:
loladenet

    The constructor receives the base query and sets both ArrayLists to null.

  • Method Details

    • getQuery

      public String getQuery()
      Returns:
      String : returns the query.

    • addStringParameter

      public void addStringParameter​(int position, String param)
      Adds a parameter to the ArrayList storing the string parameters. The insertion position corresponds to the position passed in argument (position in the query).
      Parameters:
      position - : int, position of the parameter in the query
      param - : String parameter

    • getStringParameters

      public ArrayList<String> getStringParameters()
      Returns:
      ArrayList : returns the ArrayList that contains string parameters.

    • addIntParameter

      public void addIntParameter​(int position, int param)
      Adds a parameter to the ArrayList storing the integer parameters. The insertion position corresponds to the position passed in argument (position in the query).
      Parameters:
      position - : int, position of the parameter in the query
      param - : integer parameter

    • getIntParameters

      public ArrayList<Integer> getIntParameters()
      Returns:
      ArrayList : returns the ArrayList that contains integer parameters.
